document.docAuthor: Cunha, Rosana, Martins, Luciana, Menegola, Carla & Souto, Camilla
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the sea stars (Echinodermata: Asteroidea) from Bahia State, including ontogenetic variation and an illustrated key to the Brazilian species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of the sea stars (Echinodermata: Asteroidea) from Bahia State, including ontogenetic variation and an illustrated key to the Brazilian species

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 2. Astropecten antillensis Lütken, 1860. (A) Specimen in situ (not collected; photo credit: Cláudio Sampaio). Specimen (R 43 mm) (UFBA 1620): (B) abactinal and (C) actinal view of body; (D) proximal paxillae and madreporite; (E) interradial region showing superomarginal spines; (F) interradial region showing paxillae, superomarginal and inferomarginal spines (proximal region to the right); (G) oral region; (H) actinal view of inferomarginal plates; and (I) ambulacral furrow (proximal region on the left). Scale bars: B–C, 10 mm; D–I, 2 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 3. Specimen (R 20 mm) of Astropecten antillensis Lütken, 1860 (UFBA 949): (A) abactinal and (B) actinal view of body; (C) proximal arm paxillae; (D) superomarginal plates with spines; (E) abactinal view of inferomarginal fringe spines; (F) actinal surface of arm; and (G) actinal view of inferomarginal fringe spines. Scale bars: A–B, 10 mm; C, 2 mm; D–G, 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined (3 specs, 20–43 mm R ).
BRAZIL . Bahia (12°52’– 12°56’S ; 38°12’– 38°30’W )— Busca Vida beach, Guarajuba ,
45 m
,
ii.2008
, 1 spec , R
20 mm ( UFBA 949 ). Salvador : Plataforma beach,
16 m
,
27.ix.2010
, 1 spec , R
21 mm ( UFBA 1183 ); Porto beach,
13 m
,
vi.2012
, 1 spec , R
43 mm ( UFBA 1620 )
.

Comparative material.
VIRGIN ISLAND. St. Thomas , 4 specs, R
10–56 mm ( NHMD 76172 , syntypes )
.

Biological notes. In Bahia ,
Astropecten antillensis
lives in nutrient-poor regions with sandy and muddy bottoms. This species can also be found in rubble bottoms ( Zoppi de Roa 1967 ; Alvarado & Solís-Marín 2013 ).

Syntype .
NHMD 76172 [previously as
ZMUC AST 4 ], 76371 (Tom Schiøtte, per. comm)
.
Type locality. St. Thomas, Virgin Islands .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Astropecten antillensis Lu
̈tken, 1860. (A) Specimen in situ (not collected; photo credit: Cláudio Sampaio). Specimen (R 43 mm) (UFBA 1620): (B) abactinal and (C) actinal view of body; (D) proximal paxillae and madreporite; (E) interradial region showing superomarginal spines; (F) interradial region showing paxillae, superomarginal and inferomarginal spines (proximal region to the right); (G) oral region; (H) actinal view of inferomarginal plates; and (I) ambulacral furrow (proximal region on the left). Scale bars: B–C, 10 mm; D–I, 2 mm.

FIGURE 3. Specimen (R 20 mm) of
Astropecten antillensis Lu
̈tken, 1860 (UFBA 949): (A) abactinal and (B) actinal view of body; (C) proximal arm paxillae; (D) superomarginal plates with spines; (E) abactinal view of inferomarginal fringe spines; (F) actinal surface of arm; and (G) actinal view of inferomarginal fringe spines. Scale bars: A–B, 10 mm; C, 2 mm; D–G, 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. John (1948) noticed that some of the specimens identified as
A. brasiliensis
by Sladen (1889) were actually
A. antillensis
; John’s publication was the first record of this species in Brazil . H.L. Clark (1901) most likely misidentified the
Astropecten
specimens collected in Puerto Rico because in his identification key, he reported that specimens of
A . antillensis
do not have spines on marginal plates (given that Clark mentioned in the description following the key that the specimens had inferomarginal spines, “marginal” probably referred to the superomarginal plates).
